conclusion: Understanding the problem involves finding the number of molecules in an ideal gas undergoing state changes.
The p-V diagram shows points A, B, and C with pressures and volumes marked in 10^5 Pa and 10^-3 m³.
At point A: pressure is 3 × 10^5 Pa, volume is 1 × 10^-3 m³, and temperature is -73°C.
At point B: pressure is 3 × 10^5 Pa, volume is 4 × 10^-3 m³.
At point C: pressure is 1 × 10^5 Pa, volume is 4 × 10^-3 m³.
Internal energy changes by 200 J during the process from state A to state C.
Using the ideal gas law PV = nRT to find the number of moles.
Convert temperature at A from -73°C to 200 K.
Determine process from A to B is isobaric expansion.
Determine process from B to C is isochoric decrease in pressure.
Calculate T_B using ideal gas law: T_B = 800 K.
Calculate T_C using isochoric process: T_C ≈ 266.67 K.
Calculate internal energy change ΔU = nCv(T_C - T_A) with ΔU = 200 J.
